intro: Ixoca tommasinii, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, waxy leaves that give it its common name. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. Ixoca tommasinii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
